meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Christopher Short Mark Samburg Amanda Wallwin Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6120.

td.p: Christopher Short, a pub trivia editor from Crawfordsville, Indiana
Mark Samburg, a law clerk from Essex, Connecticut
Amanda Wallwin, a creative project manager from Brooklyn, New York (whose 1-day cash winnings total $19,000)

tr.td: (Jimmy: From Chicago's Moto Restaurant--[*]. Is it cooking? Is it chemistry? Is it a little of both? )

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', '(Mark: I\'ll take "VOOLESS MOOMELS" for $200, please.)
[Laughter]

Washington, D.C.

Mark
')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_1', 'clue_J_6_1_stuck', '(Sarah gives the clue from the Moto Restaurant in Chicago, IL.) Molecular gastronomy uses science to be creative, efficient, & delicious, as in ice cream made instantly using the liquid form of this element; faster freezing means more smaller ice crystals & smoother ice cream')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah gives the clue from the Moto Restaurant in Chicago, IL.) Molecular gastronomy uses science to be creative, efficient, & delicious, as in ice cream made instantly using the liquid form of this element; faster freezing means more smaller ice crystals & smoother ice cream

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_6_3', 'clue_J_6_3_stuck', '(Amanda: What is fast?)
...
(Alex: You\'re thinking of "vite", V-I-T-E, instead of "vide", which is synonymous with "[*]" in this case.)

vacuum

Amanda
Triple Stumper
')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_6_3', 'clue_J_6_3_stuck', '(Sarah gives the clue from the Moto Restaurant in Chicago, IL.) Food is cooked to precise temperatures & uniform doneness in a water bath without the water coming into direct contact with it; the food is sealed without air so the technique is called "sous vide", "vide" meaning this')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Sarah gives the clue from the Moto Restaurant in Chicago, IL.) Food is cooked to precise temperatures & uniform doneness in a water bath without the water coming into direct contact with it; the food is sealed without air so the technique is called "sous vide", "vide" meaning this

Mark

Miracle berries expand the uses of foods like lemon by blocking the sour types of these specialized cells, which scientists now say are found all over and not in separate parts of the tongue')

div.h3: Scores at the first commercial break (after clue 15):

div.h3: Scores at the end of the Double Jeopardy! Round:

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', '
ChristopherWho is the cast of Glee?
$10,000
MarkWho are The Rolling Stones?
$10,801
AmandaWho is the Jackson 5?
$11,901
the cast of Glee')
div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_FJ', 'clue_FJ_stuck', 'In 2010 they broke The Beatles\' record for having had the most songs on the Hot 100 chart by a non-solo act')

tr.td: In 2010 they broke The Beatles' record for having had the most songs on the Hot 100 chart by a non-solo act
